sections.heading: JLPT N4 Grammar Overview
sections.content: JLPT N4 builds on N5 foundations and introduces more complex sentence structures, causative and passive forms, and various functional expressions. This list covers approximately 100 essential grammar points for N4.

children.heading: Causative Form - 〜させる/〜せる
children.content: 子供に野菜を食べさせる。 Kodomo ni yasai wo tabesaseru. "Make a child eat vegetables."

children.heading: Passive Form - 〜られる/〜れる
children.content: 先生に褒められた。 Sensei ni home rareta. "I was praised by the teacher."

children.heading: Causative-Passive - 〜させられる
children.content: 宿題をさせられた。 Shukudai wo saserareta. "I was made to do homework."

children.heading: Potential Form - 〜られる/〜える
children.content: 泳げます。 Oyogemasu. "I can swim."

children.heading: Volitional Form - 〜よう/〜おう
children.content: 一緒に行こう。 Issho ni ikou. "Let's go together."

children.heading: 〜てある - Has been done
children.content:
See: 〜てある (Is done)

窓が開けてある。 Mado ga akete aru. "The window has been opened."

children.heading: 〜ておく - Do in advance
children.content:
See: 〜ておく (Have done in advance)

準備しておきます。 Junbi shite okimasu. "I'll prepare in advance."

children.heading: 〜てしまう - Completely/Regrettably
children.content:
See: 〜てしまう (Has ended up)

忘れてしまった。 Wasurete shimatta. "I forgot (unfortunately)."

children.heading: 〜てみる - Try doing
children.content: 食べてみます。 Tabete mimasu. "I'll try eating it."

children.heading: 〜てあげる - Do for someone
children.content: 手伝ってあげる。 Tetsudatte ageru. "I'll help (for someone)."

children.heading: 〜てくれる - Do for me
children.content: 教えてくれた。 Oshiete kureta. "He taught me."

children.heading: 〜てもらう - Have someone do
children.content: 説明してもらった。 Setsumei shite moratta. "I had someone explain."

children.heading: 〜くなる - Become (i-adj)
children.content:
See: 〜くなる (Become - i-adj)

寒くなりました。 Samuku narimashita. "It became cold."

children.heading: 〜になる - Become (na-adj/noun)
children.content:
See: 〜になる (Become - na-adj/noun)

医者になりたい。 Isha ni naritai. "I want to become a doctor."

children.heading: 〜くする - Make (i-adj)
children.content:
See: 〜くする (Make - i-adj)

部屋を暖かくする。 Heya wo atatakaku suru. "Make the room warm."

children.heading: 〜にする - Make/decide (na-adj/noun)
children.content:
See: 〜にする (Make - na-adj/noun)

これにします。 Kore ni shimasu. "I'll take this."

children.heading: 〜から - Because
children.content: 忙しいから行けません。 Isogashii kara ikemasen. "I can't go because I'm busy."

children.heading: 〜ので - Because/Since (formal)
children.content: 雨なので中止です。 Ame na node chuushi desu. "It's canceled because of rain."

children.heading: 〜のだ/んだ - Explanatory
children.content: 疲れているんです。 Tsukarete irun desu. "The thing is, I'm tired."

children.heading: 〜けど/けれど - But
children.content:
See: 〜けど (But)

高いけど買います。 Takai kedo kaimasu. "It's expensive, but I'll buy it."

children.heading: 〜のに - Even though/Despite
children.content:
See: 〜のに (Even though)

勉強したのに落ちた。 Benkyou shita noni ochita. "I failed even though I studied."

children.heading: 〜ても - Even if
children.content:
See: 〜ても (Even if)

雨が降っても行く。 Ame ga futte mo iku. "I'll go even if it rains."

children.heading: 〜が - But (formal)
children.content:
See: 〜が (However)

高いですが、買います。 Takai desu ga, kaimasu. "It's expensive, but I'll buy it."

children.heading: 〜やすい - Easy to
children.content:
See: 〜やすい (Easy to)

この本は読みやすい。 Kono hon wa yomiyasui. "This book is easy to read."

children.heading: 〜にくい - Hard to
children.content:
See: 〜にくい (Hard to)

この文字は読みにくい。 Kono moji wa yominikui. "This character is hard to read."

children.heading: 〜ながら - While
children.content:
See: 〜ながら (While)

音楽を聞きながら勉強する。 Ongaku wo kikinagara benkyou suru. "Study while listening to music."

children.heading: 〜まま - As is/While
children.content:
See: 〜まま (As is/While)

座ったまま食べる。 Suwatta mama taberu. "Eat while sitting."

children.heading: 〜たら - If/When
children.content: 雨が降ったら中止です。 Ame ga futtara chuushi desu. "If it rains, it's canceled."

children.heading: 〜なら - If (condition)
children.content: 行くなら一緒に行こう。 Iku nara issho ni ikou. "If you're going, let's go together."

children.heading: 〜ば - If (conditional)
children.content: 安ければ買います。 Yasukereba kaimasu. "If it's cheap, I'll buy it."

children.heading: 〜と - When/If (natural result)
children.content: 春になると暖かくなる。 Haru ni naru to atatakaku naru. "When spring comes, it gets warm."

children.heading: 〜ために - In order to/For
children.content: 勉強するために図書館に行く。 Benkyou suru tame ni toshokan ni iku. "Go to the library to study."

children.heading: 〜ように - So that/In order to
children.content: 忘れないようにメモする。 Wasurenai you ni memo suru. "Take notes so as not to forget."

children.heading: 〜に行く/来る - Go/come to do
children.content: 映画を見に行く。 Eiga wo mi ni iku. "Go to watch a movie."

children.heading: 〜ことができる - Can do/Able to
children.content: 日本語を話すことができます。 Nihongo wo hanasu koto ga dekimasu. "I can speak Japanese."

children.heading: 〜られる - Can (potential)
children.content: 泳げますか。 Oyogemasu ka. "Can you swim?"

children.heading: 〜たことがある - Have done before
children.content: 日本に行ったことがあります。 Nihon ni itta koto ga arimasu. "I have been to Japan."

children.heading: 〜たばかり - Just did
children.content: 食べたばかりです。 Tabeta bakari desu. "I just ate."

children.heading: 〜ところだ - About to/Just did/Currently
children.content: 今食べるところです。 Ima taberu tokoro desu. "I'm about to eat now."

children.heading: 〜方がいい - Should/Had better
children.content: 休んだ方がいいです。 Yasunda hou ga ii desu. "You should rest."

children.heading: 〜ないで - Without doing/Don't
children.content: 食べないで寝た。 Tabenai de neta. "I slept without eating."

children.heading: 〜なくてもいい - Don't have to
children.content: 行かなくてもいいです。 Ikanakute mo ii desu. "You don't have to go."

children.heading: 〜なければならない/なきゃ - Must/Have to
children.content: 勉強しなければならない。 Benkyou shinakereba naranai. "I must study."

children.heading: 〜なくてはいけない - Must/Have to
children.content: 行かなくてはいけない。 Ikanakute wa ikenai. "I have to go."

children.heading: 〜そうだ - I heard that
children.content: 明日は雨だそうです。 Ashita wa ame da sou desu. "I heard it will rain tomorrow."

children.heading: 〜と言う/言った - Say/Said that
children.content: 行くと言いました。 Iku to iimashita. "He said he would go."

children.heading: 〜って - Casual quotation
children.content: 明日来るって。 Ashita kuru tte. "He says he'll come tomorrow."

children.heading: 〜そうだ - Looks like/Seems
children.content: 美味しそうです。 Oishisou desu. "It looks delicious."

children.heading: 〜みたいだ - Looks like/Seems
children.content: 雨みたいです。 Ame mitai desu. "It seems like rain."

children.heading: 〜らしい - Seems/Apparently
children.content: 彼は学生らしい。 Kare wa gakusei rashii. "He seems to be a student."

children.heading: あげる - Give (to someone else)
children.content: 友達にプレゼントをあげた。 Tomodachi ni purezento wo ageta. "I gave a present to my friend."

children.heading: くれる - Give (to me)
children.content: 友達がプレゼントをくれた。 Tomodachi ga purezento wo kureta. "My friend gave me a present."

children.heading: もらう - Receive
children.content: 友達にプレゼントをもらった。 Tomodachi ni purezento wo moratta. "I received a present from my friend."

children.heading: 〜すぎる - Too much/Excessive
children.content: 食べすぎた。 Tabesugita. "I ate too much."

children.heading: 〜始める - Begin to
children.content: 雨が降り始めた。 Ame ga furihajimeta. "It started to rain."

children.heading: 〜続ける - Continue to
children.content: 走り続ける。 Hashiritsuzukeru. "Continue running."

children.heading: 〜終わる - Finish doing
children.content: 読み終わった。 Yomiowatta. "I finished reading."

children.heading: 〜かもしれない - Might/Maybe
children.content: 雨かもしれない。 Ame kamo shirenai. "It might rain."

children.heading: 〜でしょう - Probably/I think
children.content: 明日は晴れでしょう。 Ashita wa hare deshou. "It will probably be sunny tomorrow."

children.heading: 〜つもりだ - Plan to/Intend to
children.content: 日本に行くつもりです。 Nihon ni iku tsumori desu. "I plan to go to Japan."

children.heading: 〜予定だ - Plan to/Scheduled to
children.content: 明日出発する予定です。 Ashita shuppatsu suru yotei desu. "I'm scheduled to depart tomorrow."

sections.heading: Study Tips for N4 Grammar
sections.content: Master verb conjugations - Causative, passive, potential Practice て-form combinations - てあげる, てくれる, てもらう Understand nuance differences - Similar patterns have different uses Use grammar in conversations - Don't just memorize, apply Review N5 regularly - N4 builds on N5 foundations

sections.heading: Next Steps
sections.content:
After mastering N4 grammar, progress to:

JLPT N3 Grammar - Intermediate level Practice more complex sentence structures Focus on formal vs casual expressions

Note: This list covers core N4 grammar points. Practice materials may vary slightly in their classification.
